definition: to resell at a profit/to speculate
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to buy and sell at a profit/to speculate

sentences.english: A occasional chance, He a guns second-hand resell to commons armed force army.
sentences.chinese: 一个偶然的机会，他把枪支转手倒卖给民间武装军队。

sentences.english: He made his living by scalping tickets to the baseball game.
sentences.chinese: 他就靠倒卖棒球观赛票来过活。

sentences.english: Such privileges fuel a lively black market in highly priced hukousof favoured cities.
sentences.chinese: 这样的特权产生了一个充满活力的户口倒卖市场。

sentences.english: Speculation and transfer of certificates for ephedrine purchase and use shall be prohibited.
sentences.chinese: 禁止倒卖和转让麻黄素购用证明。

sentences.english: It's government property and illegal to keep it or try to sell it.
sentences.chinese: 那是政府财产，任何私藏或倒卖行为均属违法。

sentences.english: He earned a lot by scalping.
sentences.chinese: 他在倒卖股票的生意中赚了一大笔。

sentences.english: Speculation and transfer of ephedrine export licenses and certificates of purchase and use for export are prohibited.
sentences.chinese: 禁止倒卖和转让麻黄素出口许可证和出口购用证明。
到了1987年，这种倒买倒卖的行为才被禁止。

sentences.english: As soon as he receives the goods, the buyer sells the goods and absconds with the money.
sentences.chinese: 他一收到货就立即将其倒卖，携款潜逃。

sentences.english: Resale of imported materials and parts is not permitted.
